intro: Arenaria salweenensis, commonly known as the Salween sandflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pink or white, adding a delicate touch to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
